p: We observed a large variability among studies in the literature on SGI rates over time ( Extended Data 9) that did not appear to be attributable to the following study characteristics: mosquito strain, viral strain, viral titer, temperature or humidity during mosquito rearing, or fresh versus frozen viral stock. Notably, we observed a close similarity in posterior estimates of the mean EIP based on the dissemination and salivary gland data for both our experimental data and the meta-analysis ( Table S2). Based on these observations, as well as the fact that published studies exhibited more consistency in estimating dissemination rates ( Fig. 3a), and we had considerably more experimental data points to fit to the model for dissemination to legs/wings than to the salivary glands, we chose to focus our subsequent analysis exclusively on the dissemination data.
